body.p:
Augusta Ky
March 25th 1863
Hon Jas. W. Tate
Dear Sir

I write by the same mail which conveys this a letter, one to Gov. Robinson in reference to a fine imposed upon a gentleman by the name of John Elliott of Bracken County -- He was fined for giving a negro man a "horn" of Whiskey at an oyster supper given by his (the negros) young master & others, and in the presence of his young master --

The fine was for record
by an Enemy of Elliotts & not by the owner of the slave --

Mr Elliott is a Hotel Keeper & a clever gentleman, & I think with others that the fine should be remitted under the circumstances -- Upon such an occasion as that, in the presence of the negros Master, who one would dream of being made responsible for giving him a dram under the circumstances,

Please call the Governors ear attention to this matter at your his earliest leisure
& if remitted enclose the evidence to me --

Sincerely your friend
Thornton F. Marshall
